Articles.Content: Does anyone know of a windows tool that lets you capture and store the state of a single process and then restore it at your leisure? I'm looking for a functionality similar to virtual machine snapshots (or the Action Replay cartridge's freeze button if you're old enough to remember that )but centered around a single process. Would that even work? Can it be done? With such a tool one could revert a nearing the 3,7 GB limit KSP.exe to its initial, post-startup state.
